intro: Maytenus samydiformis, commonly known as the Samydiform mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Salicaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
